fields.summary: storePage fails if content and title both change

fields.description:
We have both JIRA and Confluence running on the same host, but on different ports. Apache sits in front and forwards request with mod_proxy.

JIRA is public available on http://jira.foo.com which is forwarded to myhost.foo.com:8090.
Confluence is public available on http://confluence.foo.com which is forwarded to myhost.foo.com:8091.

When displaying JIRA issues in Confluence the URL to all icons is set to localhost:8090/images/... not jira.foo.com/images/...
fields.summary: JIRA issues macro is not displaying icons correct

fields.description:
Support for "Shared mode" was dropped in v2.5.3, but the updater doesn't turn the mode off when upgrading to this version.

If the shared mode was on before the update, Confluence still runs in the shared mode after the update and there is no obvious way how to turn this mode off because the gui in admin console is gone.

Confluence should check during the installation if the shared mode is on, and if it is, it should turn if off - ideally creating a log about this as well.

The main side effect of this is that while the shared mode is on, confluence suffers from bug: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-7908 which now makes it impossible to create new spaces
fields.summary: Updater doesn't turn the "shared mode" off when upgrading to a version that doesn't expose shared mode setting via admin console

fields.description:
I have a user who only has view permissions to a space.
Logging on as that user, I went to the Info tab of a page.
The Copy operation appeared, and I was able click the link, edit the copied page, and save it.

This must be a security hole?
fields.summary: Security issue: user can copy page with only view permissions

fields.description:
When Confluence is started for the first time after an upgrade that requires db schema modification, the SQLs are executed one after another, even if one (or all) of the SQLs failed. If a schema update error occurs, the update should abort to avoid any data corruption.

fields.description:
The {popular} macro says that {popular:timespan=1m} means one month, but it is in fact just one minute as one can easily verify by comparing the result of {popular:timespan=60m}  with the output of {popular:timespan=1h} (which are the same).

So either the documentation is wrong or the code.
fields.summary: {popular} macro has either incorrect documentation or a bug
Thumbnail support for video attachments

fields.description:
From comments on my blog about my introduction to Confluence presentation: http://fishbowl.pastiche.org/2004/12/15/the_cognitive_style_of_keynote#comment-8530

"This request may be more appropriate for conf-user, but I'd love to see this presentation adapted to run without a presenter. My group has a very flat power structure; we have Confluence but I can't make them use it. I think a standalone version of your presentation would show them the light."

And from a sales email:

"do you have a guide or something similar, that explains how to work with a wiki? (something like a process description, that defines how many people work on the same pages, how to see what changed, how to aviod conflicts...)"

Some kind of step by step presentation that works as a graphical walk-through of Confluence's features, explaining how and why you would use them would be good for our users, and probably also a good sales tool.
fields.summary: CLONE -Write "Guide to Using Confluence"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8872].
  {panel}

Users frequently want to group pages according to topic. However, new users frequently create a manually maintained list that can be extremely difficult to revise or expand on down the track, compared to the same list created dynamically using labels. The best way to address this is to add some documentation on how to structure content and list it based on labels. When you need to change categories, just replace the labels and everything automatically reshuffles.

- Expand on http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF20/Categorising+Wiki+Content+Using+Labels or create a new page detailing how to use and display labels
- Add instructions to ContentByLabel and this page on how to pare the content down to only show page titles
- It would be useful to link this to a getting started guide explaining how to partition content, how to use macros etc

--- Example manual list ---
Vehicles
[Toyota Prius]
[Honda Civic]
[Harley Davidson Sportster]
[Suzuki GSX-R]

Cars
[Toyota Prius]
[Honda Civic]

Motorbikes
[Harley Davidson Sportster]
[Suzuki GSX-R]

--- Smart List ---
Vehicles
{contentbylabel:vehicles|showLabels=false|maxResults=99|showSpace=false}

Cars
{contentbylabel:cars|showLabels=false|maxResults=99|showSpace=false}

Motorbikes
{contentbylabel:motorbikes|showLabels=false|maxResults=99|showSpace=false}
fields.summary: Add guide to efficiently grouping pages by topic using labels and expand on 'Categorising Wiki Content Using Labels'

fields.description: As it stands, a user must explicitly decide to watch every space they care about. Often, caring about a space is triggered by having contributed to it in some fashion. It would be nice if a default notification mode could be set to send users notifications for every page they edited or commented on. In the user profile they could turn it off, or they could stop watching a particular page or space if they no longer cared about it. As it stands, a user can contribute to content across many spaces, and lose track of them because they didn't remember to watch each space.
fields.summary: Would like notifications by default for content I edit
JavaScript error occurs when editing a page without having permission to restrict it

fields.description:
When using the User Lister Macro to display group that doesn't exists, an unhandled null pointer exception will be raised in com.atlassian.user.search.page.PagerUtils.toList() method. Example wiki markup to trigger the bug:

{userlister:groups=nosuchgroup}

On the rendered wiki page, the macro is expanded to the error message:

Error formatting macro: userlister: java.lang.NullPointerException

Relevant parts of the stack trace:

[15:40:13.959] 2007-07-09 15:40:13,955 ERROR [resin-tcp-connection-*:7811-13] [renderer.v2.components.MacroRendererComponent] processMacro Unexpected error formatting macro: userlister
[15:40:13.959]  -- url: /wiki-devel/display/SAND/Home | userName: tj | action: viewpage | page: 268
[15:40:13.959] java.lang.NullPointerException
[15:40:13.959]  at com.atlassian.user.search.page.PagerUtils.toList(PagerUtils.java:25)
[15:40:13.959]  at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.userlister.model.UserList.getGroupUsers(UserList.java:91)
[15:40:13.959]  at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.userlister.model.UserList.build(UserList.java:39)
[15:40:13.959]  at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.userlister.UserLister.execute(UserLister.java:79)
[15:40:13.959]  at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.macro.ResourceAwareMacroDecorator.execute(ResourceAwareMacroDecorator.java:45)
[15:40:13.959]  at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.components.MacroRendererComponent.processMacro(MacroRendererComponent.java:340)
[15:40:13.959]  at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.components.MacroRendererComponent.makeMacro(MacroRendererComponent.java:241)
[15:40:13.959]  at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.components.MacroRendererComponent.makeMacro(MacroRendererComponent.java:130)
[15:40:13.959]  at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.components.MacroRendererComponent.handlePotentialMacro(MacroRendererComponent.java:115)
[15:40:13.959]  at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.components.MacroRendererComponent.render(MacroRendererComponent.java:77)
[15:40:13.959]  at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.V2Renderer.render(V2Renderer.java:54)
[15:40:13.959]  at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.V2RendererFacade.convertWikiToXHtml(V2RendererFacade.java:57)
[ .... ]

The method com.atlassian.user.search.page.PagerUtils.toList() should check that the Pager argument is not null before invoking methods of the object and either return null if the argument was null or throw an IllegalArgumentException (in which case the possible errors should be avoided by checking the nullness of the argument in each instances where com.atlassian.user.search.page.PagerUtils.toList() is invoked prior the invocation). See the attached patch.
fields.summary: Userlister plugin causes NullPointerException

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian status as of October 26, 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
I’m excited to let you know that the [latest release of Crowd Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/crowd/crowd-3-3-release-notes-958762272.html] features the ability for you to delegate user admin management to space admins, with the ‘delegated group level admin’ feature.

For those of you who aren’t familiar with [Crowd Data Center|https://www.atlassian.com/software/crowd/enterprise/data-center], it offers one place to manage your users, groups and directories and easily integrate your identity infrastructure across all self-hosted Atlassian products 

I’m leaving this suggestion open, as I appreciate that this only provides a solution to those of you who currently have, or are considering investing in Crowd. However, to set expectations, this isn’t something we’re currently planning on working on within Confluence Server or Data Center.

Best
Jenny | Senior Product Manager, Confluence Server

{panel}

Given the credentials and settings are all the same, in an ideal world, I would like to specify as

<host>host1|host2|host3</host>

Confluence could then try to connect to host1, failover to 2, failover to 3.

This is a single point of failure that would require a re-deployment to resolve, and could be avoided with this fix.

fields.description:
Currently, when an attachment is edited, Confluence updates the Date and loses the original create date.  This is very misleading since only descriptive data has changed - the original file has not (and cannot be) changed.

When dealing with attachments, the date the file was loaded is what is really important.   The original creation date should therefore be retained and displayed in the Attachments Macro listing.  Minor descriptive changes such as the filename, comments, and page location that can occur months or years later should not overwrite this basic information.  Microsoft Windows recognizes this importance in its own conventions - you can change the file name, move the file, and even copy the file without affecting the file date.

In a recent Confluence version update, this distinction was recognized in a change in the way Confluence handles the creator field - Confluence used to just replace the Creator with the name of the editor but now puts the modifier's name after the original creator in parenthesis if its different (see screen print). 

That convention could be extended to include the date.  The original create date should be retained and the modified date should be put into the parenthesis, i.e. John Doe  (last modified by Jane Doe on July nn, nnnnn).

The attachment macro should also be changed to:
1. Show the original Creator with the modifier in parenthesis (with wrapping so it doesn't take too much column space).
2. Show the original Create date

Finally, when the only action is to change the page the attachment is on, the Creator parenthetic should be changed from "modified" to "moved"  (moving is not a significant modification).
fields.summary: Retain the Original Create Date on Attachments despite Edits to FileName, Comment Type, Content Type, or Page location

fields.description:
Bug 100% reproducible with both v 1.0 (#100) and v 1.0.1 (#101) of the Social Bookmarking Plugin, and version 2.3-dr6 and 2.3-dr5 of the Scaffolding Plugin. It doesn't seem to be tied to a specific version of Confluence or the JDK.

Problem: a page has the following content: "{live-template:Some Template}" with scaffolding data in it.

Normal behavior: clicking the Edit link should go to the "Edit Data" screen.

Bug: clicking Edit triggers the Rich Text Editor, showing just "{live-template:Some Template}" and bypassing the scaffolding plugin.

Uninstalling the Social Bookmarking Plugin is not enough to stop this behavior, it is necessary to stop and restart Confluence to get the Scaffolding plugin back to work.
fields.summary: The Social Bookmarking Plugin breaks the Scaffolding Plugin
Mail view permission

fields.description:
Naming a page with a single dot (.) will lock the page, i.e. it becomes impossible to access the page, making it impossible to edit it to change its name. If this is done on the home page of a space, then it becomes impossible to access the space (*). Only workaround found is to export the whole Confluence instance and manually edit the entities.xml file to rename <property name="title"><![CDATA[.]]></property> into something else, then import the whole instance.

Confluence should forbid a page name consisting of a single dot.

(*) in Firefox this results into an error message saying that Firefox has detected a redirection that won't work. Basically: trying to access http://<confluence server name>/display/spacekey/. or http://<confluence server name>/display/spacekey redirects to http://<confluence server name>/display/spacekey/ which results in an error.
fields.summary: Naming a page with a single dot locks page or space

fields.description:
The input from "Add Labels" text box is not properly validated. There are two major flaws:
1) the string length is not validated - if string is longer than 255 characters an error message is displayed: "[41a] Error connecting to the server. The labels have not been updated."

2) the input is not properly escaped and lets html pass through - "<" and ">" are allowed characters (why?!?!?) and are not even being properly escaped - this makes is super easy to modify the DOM structure and modify the look of the site. See http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEST/Label+Validation+Problem for examples. Only the fact that ":" and "(" are not allowed characters makes it difficult to use this hole for an XSS exploit - but the possibility of finding a way to create a XSS exploit using this hole still exists.

Suggested fix:
1) add length validation
2) there are two ways how to fix the second issue
   a) add "<" and ">" as well as "\" and  "/" among forbidden characters
   b) encode the string using html entities (http://www.w3schools.com/tags/ref_entities.asp)
fields.summary: Input for Labels is not properly validated

fields.description:
After importing a global backup, you are unable to perform any operations that write to the database, such as creating a new page. This only occurs when using the embedded HSQL. It does not happen when using a standalone database.

The work around is to restart Confluence after the import and then all will be fine.

So to reproduce -
* start Confluence
* perform a backup
* import the backup

fields.summary: Importing a backup when using HSQL leaves Confluence broken

fields.description:
There are 2 Confluence instances, let's call them:
# Evaluation environment
# Test environment

In Evaluation environment,  there are 2 spaces (contain child page and labels) with the same space name (test1) but with different space ID (test1,test 2). Then these spaces are exported and to be imported to Test environment. 

In the test environment, importing the space (spaceid=test1) works fine with all labels presented. After that, when importing the space (spaceid=test2),labels  are missing.

It seems that when importing 2 spaces which have the same name yet different space ID:
1. The first import works fine, labels and content imported correctly.
2. The second import shows no error during import, content imported correctly yet it fails to import labels.

Please see the attachments for screen shot examples.
fields.summary: Labels missing when importing 2 spaces with the same space name but different  space ID

fields.description:
The tabnav ID is applied to all tab navigation elements, which means it can appear multiple times on the same page. Editing an existing page is one example.

The tabnav ID should be made a class, and the stylesheet needs to by updated and tested appropriately. (The specificity of a class is lower than an ID, so there may be stylesheet ramifications.)
fields.summary: Tabnav ID appears multiple times in markup; should be a class

fields.description: These are now only applied to #tabnav, so any old themes that use #foldernav are left with unstyled tabs. We need to fix this.
fields.summary: Foldernav styles have disappeared in new stylesheet

fields.description:
The calendar plugin layout breaks completely.

It can't include its own stylesheet, apparently.
fields.summary: New theme breaks Calendar plugin completely

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8812].
  {panel}

It could be useful to enable specifying a time interval of when page notifications on updates should be sent to users. This would also take care of problem with RSS feeds where these are not conisdered to be page UPDATE actions. Thus no notifications would be sent.

*PageNotificationsListener* <------------ *CONTENT*.table changes
(page EVENTS)
     \|
<task>
   \| 
*TaskManager*
(list of tasks)
  \|
<queue of tasks>
  \|
*MailQueueFlushJob*
  \|
<execute tasks>
  \|
*SchedullingSubsystemContext.xml*
(bean id = MailQueueFlushJob)
  \|
<timer is set in {{bean id = mailQueueTrigger}} >
  \|
{{mailQueueTrigger contains reference to the MailQueueFlushJob}}
 \|
{{ <value> 0 0 0 * * ? <value> }}

// send emails daily for the list of tasks not only when page EVEN is triggered
fields.summary: Enable sending of page UPDATE notification at specified time interval - page WATCH

fields.description:
Many users with business-critical content are interested in hosting an offsite clone of Confluence for backup purposes. Since it's possible to request a site backup via remote API, it would be useful to have the second instance automatically pull down backups from the primary, eg every 6 hours. Since backups can only be imported by an instance that is running, this would help mitigate the risk of business users are unable to retrieve important information if the primary instance get knocked offline, assuming that the same event does not affect the offsite backup.

The Admin screen could have a new option for this with the remote instance URL, login and backup frequency. If relatively easy to do, it would also be useful to have the option of disabling write access for the backup instance and adding custom footer that did not get overwritten by the site imports indicating the clone's status as a backup and ideally the most recent backup date.
fields.summary: Confluence clones that regularly import the XML site backup from a remote Confluence instance

fields.description:
When HibernateConfluenceBandanaRecordDao class is used by 2 threads there is a possibility of deadlock because saveOrUpdate method is synchronized. 
Together with database locking it may produce a deadlock.

In this case "Invite" plug-in runs two threads once a day (Remove Unnecessary Invitations Job and Expire Invitations Job). Both use saveOrUpdate synchronized method in a loop.
One of the threads enters saveOrUpdate method and locks the Bandana table in the database - when it exists the method the table is still locked as transaction is not yet committed.
When another thread enters the same method it cannot proceed because database is locked. The initial thread cannot finish its own transaction and commit changes because
it cannot enter the saveOrUpdate method again as the second thread holds the lock on HibernateConfluenceBandanaRecordDao. Hence there is a deadlock.

Synchronization of saveOrUpdate looks redundant as no class instance variables are used in this method. Fix should probably be as simple as removing synchronization.
fields.summary: Deadlock when working with Bandana table, database locks and thread locks

fields.description:
We have Confluence deployed on a tomcat instance behind an apache acting as a reverse proxy. The reverse proxy is configured to redirect to HTTPS for security reasons:

<Location /confluence>
        RewriteEngine on
        RewriteCond %{HTTPS} off
        RewriteRule . https://%{HTTP_HOST}%{REQUEST_URI}  [L]
</Location>

ProxyPass /confluence http://localhost:8281/confluence
ProxyPassReverse /confluence http://localhost:8281/confluence

Unfortunately it seems one quite persistent bug seems to bite us: CONF-8112. Attached is a LiveHTTP-Header log (domain changed).
fields.summary: %2F makes deployment behind reverse proxy with redirect to HTTPS impossible

fields.description:
When creating a new group and adding a lot of existing users to it, it's unreasonable to make an admin go to each user's profile, select "Update Groups", and assign the user to the group.

Requested: *Allow full administration of group membership on the group admin page*.
fields.summary: Assign Users to Groups on Group Admin Page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8807].
  {panel}

The Principle of Least Authority requires that I be able to grant a user all the authority he needs and no more, but one cannot give authority to administer one Confluence user group without giving authority to administer all groups - and all functions of the wiki - with it.

Likewise, the ability to create a group is only available to those in the admin group. It would be preferable, if any user were to create a space within a wiki, that that user could control the membership in the groups that he gave access to the space. If the user could create a group and thus be its default administrator just as creating a space makes the creator its default administrator, that would be ideal.

As it stands, however, our site administrators must create and administer all groups regardless of who gives them what privileges.  This is acceptable while the site's contributing membership is small, but if this is to become a true Social Networking site, the need for every space administrator to go to the Confluence admins to create and administer groups for their own space presents not only an annoying delay for them but an unacceptable burden to the site's admins.

To summarize, then:

*Specific administration rights should exist over any user group, assignable by anyone with the appropriate rights, and any user should be able to create a user group, becoming by default its administrator, just as for spaces.*
fields.summary: Separation of Authority - Granting Admin Authority Over Individual Group Memberships

fields.description:
Having a dynamic search macro with a query term which matches a prefix of the page title of the page it is in, doesn't terminate and displaying the web page hangs.

Example:

Having a page with title "Search Test" and a statement of
\{search:query=search\} 
will hang the browser.

This issue did not exist in 2.2.10.
fields.summary: Dynamic search doesn't terminate

fields.description:
Here are some additional fixes/changes in relation to the new Confluence typography...

- All headings for the recently updated display are showing up as "Recently Updated - All Spaces", even when it is in a single space
- Fixed length of comment boxes doesn't work in Windows
- Insert the word "Edited:" a the line above the name and date of the latest edit
- Drop the pagetitle back to 18pt
- Change the bodyfont to 10pt
- Change the border of all comment and update boxes to 1px
- Fix the left and right padding around the page content so that it is equal on both sides

Let the UI team know if any of this is unclear :)
fields.summary: Typography Fixes

fields.description: Edit User Group page does not display properly in IE. The "Join" and "Leave" panels do not align next to each other in a straight line. Screenshot has been attached.
fields.summary: Edit User Group page does not display properly in IE
New quoted typography doesn't un-italicise <em> markup

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8801].
  {panel}

I was asked here CSP-9847 to post a new issue...

*Use case:* I want to have a page in Confluence which I can design with one thought towards usability in the system, while having real content I might want to print/export to PDF. So for example, I have a list of "what's new" features but also on the right side a {children} macro so the user can navigate to other related issues.

*Problem:* I want to send a customer a PDF or print a hard copy of this page. when I do, I get the index (children) content on the page. Even worse, because I used {section} and {column} macros, the PDF looks horrible. Obviously, "in design time", when I make the page I know that if I print it or PDF it, the only real content is the section talking about what's new. 

*Request:* I need either to add more options to existing macros to say noprint. Like you have for TOC, (specifically, children, section and column) *or better ->* a general {noprint} macro so that anything between start and end is not part of printing or PDF export.
fields.summary: general {noprint}<whatever section>{noprint} macro

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8800].
  {panel}

It would be nice to be able to change the spaceKey structure. For the moment, the key is only composed by [a-zA-Z0-9]

I'm interested to use - or _

It is possible in JIRA by changing the jira-application.properties file:
  # If you wish to have alphaNumeric project keys, use the pattern:  ([A-Z][A-Z0-9]+)
  jira.projectkey.pattern = ([a-zA-Z0-9_-]*)
fields.summary: Change the spaceKey pattern
Ability to get "effective permissions" on confluence pages

fields.description: User macros embedded in a line(or on it's own line) creates extra lines when going between wiki markup and rich text editor. It's similar but not the same to CONF-7628 which was resolved. In that new lines were created repeatedly. 1. Define User Macro Macro Name: p Macro Body: Macro has a Body (use unprocessed macro body) Output: Macro generates html markup Template: $body 2. edit in wiki mode Some text before inline macro {p}Macro Body{p} more text after inline macro. 3. save and view Some text before inline macro Macro Body more text after inline macro. 4. open in rte brings Some text before inline macro {p}Macro Body{p}  more text after inline macro. 5. after save we got the following page view with 2 unwanted newlines before the macro and 2 unwanted macros after macro Some text before inline macro Macro Body more text after inline macro. When we use a user macro which generates wiki markup its even worse. Than we got unwanted newlines even in the wiki editor.
fields.summary: Rich text editor adds new line before and after inline user macros

fields.description:
If you save a file name with spaces on it ('file name.doc') with IE7; it gets saved as 'file+name.doc'.

This is a really annoying as when you do upload the doco back to confluence you need to manually remove the '+' otherwise it would not be recognised as a revisions of an existing doco.

However, in Firefox 2 this works fine!
fields.summary: Filename with spaces (i.e. 'sample name.doc') gets saved as 'sample+name.doc'
Add ability to Customize Page Watch E-mails

fields.description:
If two people create a child page with the same name, under the same parent page: the second page to be saved will overwrite the content of the first page saved.

Steps to replicate the problem:
    * User A adds a child page to the parent page, with page name = 'test'.
    * User A begins creating the content (has not yet saved).
    * User B adds a page with the same name and begins creating the content.

**No Warning message will appear for either user A or User B**

    * User A finishes and hits 'Save'.
    * User B finishes after user A and hits 'Save'.

** User B sees a warning message like 'The title test already exists in space DOC' - see attached screenshot 1.

   * User B hits 'Save' anyway, ignoring the message.

The last person to save this page 'wins' and their version is the one that is stored. (User B)
User A's version of the page does not appear in the page history on the info tab, nor is their page version listed in any of the recently edited lists.

________________________________
*See also a similar issue reported by a customer:*
Note that the customer didn't receive the message that is mentioned in the original JIRA description. They were creating the child page from the same in-page link. They are on Version 2.1.3 Build:#408.

This warning message does not appear, and confluence content appears to be 'lost'(!!) If two users are trying to both create the same page at the same time.
Example:
    * User A creates a child page by adding [New Page_Pagename] to the parent page.
    * User A clicks on this link and begins creating the content
    * User B clicks on this link and begins creating the content.
**No Warning message will appear for either user A or User B**
    * User A finishes and hits 'Save'
    * User B finishes after user A and hits 'Save'
The last person to save this page 'wins' and their version is the one that is stored. (User B)
Oddly User A's version of the page does not appear in the page history on the info tab, nor is their page version listed in any of the recently edited lists.
If user A goes to edit this page again, they will NOT receive a message that reads "A New Page you were adding/previous version of this page exist..."
However
If user A attempts to create another new page, they will receive the above message and be able to merge their content onto the saved version of the page.
________________________________
fields.summary: Concurrent Add Page warns but then overwrites and loses data

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8779].
  {panel}

Any private feed generated using the RSS Builder fails with "Could not retrieve ...RSS... - Not Permitted". The cause is that users need to manually append their plaintext username and password to the URL, but the feed builder only provides a short hint about this. Confluence should have step by step instructions for users with adding the plaintext password to the URL in the interface, or generate URLs that don't require this workaround by implementing CONF-8406.

Examples of user problems with the current process:
- http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257249386&#257249386
- http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+User+Guide?focusedCommentId=15204513#comment-15204513
- http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/%28outdated%29+RSS+Feed+Macro?focusedCommentId=3276935#comment-3276935
- http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/RSS?focusedCommentId=119706#comment-119706
- http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/RSS+Feed+Macro?focusedCommentId=195228#comment-195228

UI issues
- The Confluence interface should provide step by step instructions on appending the login to the URL provided

Online documentation issues
- The existing online documentation is misleading as users are appending the actual string "?os_username=yourusername&os_password=yourpassword" without any substitution. The instructions at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF25/Subscribing+to+RSS+Feeds+within+Confluence should explain how to substitute an actual login into the example string.
- To assist users with finding the instructions, http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF25/Working+with+RSS+Feeds and http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF25/Tracking+Updates+Overview should mention http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF25/RSS+Feed+Macro or the workaround should be mentioned on http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF25/RSS+Feed+Macro as well
fields.summary: Clarify instructions for generating authenticated internal RSS feed authentication

fields.description:
In the [Checklists Plugin|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Checklists+Plugin] I am setting metadata values without modifying the actual pages. It works fine, problem is that data set through the plugin do not get indexed (see [CHK-18|http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/CHK-18]). 

The metadata plugin already provides an extractor, so it is just a matter of invoking it. There gotta be a way to reindex the page on demand, without having to modify the page.

As per lack of response on http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=18154&tstart=15 this doesn't seem to be possible :-(

fields.description:
Email addresses are displayed when you search for users in the edit page restrictions page - even if Confluece is set up to display emails only to admins. User has to have "restrict" + "create" permission to be able to access the user lookup.


How to reproduce:
Log in as a regular user (without admin privileges). Go to a page, click Edit, scroll down to "Restrictions". Click on "Choose users" and enter some string.

Result:
Users are listed with their email addresses displayed.

Expected Result:
List of users with emails hidden.

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian Folks

We - here at local.ch  - love your software and you have been in contact with colleagues of mine like Toni and Cédric on a regular basis. 

For our next level of organizational development we'd like to do the following: A distributed and growing team (we're working across five locations and glue the thing together with wiki / jira and skype chats) needs over time to get a more direct feel of who does what, etc. 

Our vision would be something like this: 
- A specific wiki space / subpages added to the individual project spaces where a team member can add what she/he is working on
- No this is not a comment function, we're seeking ;-)
- Rather: Every week I post a brief summary of what I've been on during the week, email (along with some tags, keywords) that to a central address. 
- Some sort of central application adds my email to my personal space, a team member overview space (so one can easily see what all other are doing) and for documentation purposes that same email gets annotated to the relevant project space to track what has been done. 

The goal is to get a distributed team up on the same knowledge level quickly and just as distributed as their work habits.

We played a bit around with a wordpress (internal) publishing platform. However, we'd love to get such a thing from you.

Any ideas/clues/opinions?

Thanks for comments!
fields.summary: Cross over Blog / Wiki

fields.description:
The heading styles of the following format should be retained across all versions of the Left Navigation Theme when it is bundled with Confluence. Try testing with Confluence 2.2.2 and Confluence 2.5.3, switching from the Default theme to Left Navigation Theme.


{noformat}
h1. Heading 1

h2. Heading 2

h3. Heading 3

h4. Heading 4

h5. Heading 5

text
{noformat}

Note that the greyish background color has disappeared in the 2.5.3. Users prefer to retain the background color to differentiate it from normal text.

A workaround would be:

Copy the css properties for the headings (h1 h2 etc) from the Default theme located in the {{site-css.vm}} over to the {{leftnav-css.vm}} file.
fields.summary: Retain heading styles for the bundled Left Navigation Theme

fields.description:
When performing the "Mail Archiving" operation, currently the user is issued a warning "Fetching new mail will remove them from the server!" and the emails are deleted from the server after mail archiving.
The users should be given an option by which, if they desire, they can leave a copy of the emails on the server instead of deleting it from there after mail archiving.
Attached a screenshot of the warning message currently issued during Email Archiving.
fields.summary: Give the user an option to leave a copy of emails on the server during mail archiving
